Diagnostic_Criteria: Vietnamese Ministry of Health criteria (epidemiological, clinical, laboratory)
Other_Symptoms: Memory loss (19.2%), Fainting (28.3%), Limb numbness (20.0%), Vomiting/nausea (15.0%), Balance disorders (10.0%), Muscle weakness (10.0%), Blurred vision (3.3%)
Elevated_Liver_Enzymes_Percentage: Course 1: AST 66.7%, ALT 83.3%; Course 2: AST 75%, ALT 91.7%; Course 3: AST 85%, ALT 81.7%
Comments: Long-course albendazole (3x30 days) showed good efficacy with 95% showing radiological improvement. Higher complete resolution rate (43.3%) compared to typical 25-37% with shorter courses. Liver enzyme elevations were common but mostly mild and reversible.
